definition: to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more

sentences.english: It's the music of a people who are climbing to the light.
sentences.chinese: 那是一個民族歡呼，翻山越嶺見光芒。

sentences.english: Thus, tramping over hill and dale to cut firewood was the task of my elder brother and me.
sentences.chinese: 所以，翻山越嶺去打柴便是我和哥哥倆人的任務。

sentences.english: Life's a climb, but the view is great.
sentences.chinese: 生活，就像翻山越嶺，風景一定會是美麗的。

sentences.english: He struggles on the steep climb back home, a punishing scramble through woods and fields, on an empty stomach.
sentences.chinese: 他每天空着肚子翻山越嶺，穿過重重樹林，田野。

sentences.english: But instead of moving mountains why not find the easy path around them?
sentences.chinese: 但除了翻山越嶺，爲什麼不可以找到捷徑繞過去呢？

sentences.english: A wood cutter piloted our fighters over the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 一個伐木人引導我們的戰士翻山越嶺。

sentences.english: The important thing about that freedom train is it' got to climb mountains.
sentences.chinese: 主要的是自由列車之行就如同翻山越嶺。

sentences.english: Just so you know, we are under the same moon.
sentences.chinese: 縱是萬般的相隔，也敵不過翻山越嶺的祝福。

sentences.english: The people live in this cave that can only be approached by hiking through a series of stairs up the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 那些村民住在山上的大洞裏，若是外出則要翻山越嶺。

sentences.english: The policemen spent several days trekking through trees and over mountains looking for the lost boy.
sentences.chinese: 警察一連好多天穿越森林，翻山越嶺尋找失蹤的男孩。

definition: to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
making up a group, forming a troupe (idiom); in large numbers/as a large crowd
to be cut off from the rest of the world (idiom)
